alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued October 03 at 4:25PM MST until October 03 at 5:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 530 PM MST. * At 425 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from Tempe to near Phoenix International Raceway to near Liberty to near Palo Verde Nuclear Generation Station, moving south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 83 and 204. AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 195 and 200. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 92 and 178. Locations impacted include... Phoenix, Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, Tempe, Avondale, Goodyear, Buckeye, Casa Grande, Coolidge, Tolleson, Gila Bend, Laveen, Cashion and Tonopah. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
